Subject: Weekly State of the Market - Industrial Metals (2025-09-16)

Industrial Metals

Executive Summary

The latest Commitments of Traders (COT) data for Industrial Metals reveals a bifurcated market. Speculative sentiment is strongly bullish and increasing for Copper, reaching extreme levels. Aluminum MWP saw a significant bullish shift. Conversely, Aluminum remains in extreme speculative bearish territory. Steel-HRC and Cobalt indicate sustained bearishness, with commercials generally holding counter-trend positions. This setup presents both compelling opportunities and notable risks for the upcoming week.

Key Opportunities

  • Copper Sustained Momentum: Significant increase in net-longs from speculators, already at strong bullish extremes. This signals potential for continued upward price momentum, driven by high conviction.
  • ALUMINUM MWP Bullish Reversal: A substantial shift to net-long positions by speculators indicates a potential trend reversal or strengthening upward movement, offering an entry opportunity.

Key Risks

  • ALUMINUM Extreme Bearishness: Speculative net-short positioning remains at extreme levels. While suggesting downside, this creates high potential for a sharp short squeeze if any positive catalyst emerges.
  • Copper & Lithium Overextension: Highly concentrated speculative long positions in Copper and Lithium Hydroxide (both with strong bullish Z-scores) imply a significant risk of correction from profit-taking or minor negative news.

Asset Class Summaries

STEEL-HRC

  • Speculators:Dominantly bearish with a net-short position (-32 contracts), slightly increasing bearishness WoW.
  • Commercials:Maintain a significant net-short stance (-6001 contracts), increasing bearish exposure WoW.
  • Implication:Sustained bearish conviction from both groups, indicating potential for further downside.

COBALT

  • Speculators:Strongly bearish with a notable net-short position (-1697 contracts), slightly increasing bearishness WoW.
  • Commercials:Remain significantly net-short (-1301 contracts), increasing bearish bets WoW.
  • Implication:Deep-seated bearishness is reinforced by continued selling from both sides.

ALUMINUM MWP

  • Speculators:Shifted to dominantly bullish with a net-long position (1090 contracts), a substantial increase WoW.
  • Commercials:Hold a large net-short position (-10669 contracts), almost unchanged WoW.
  • Implication:Strong speculative bullish reversal sentiment against stable commercial hedging, suggesting potential upside.

ALUMINUM

  • Speculators:Extremely bearish with a significant net-short position (-200 contracts), unchanged WoW. Positioning is at an extreme bearish level (Z-score: -2.13).
  • Commercials:Strongly bullish with a net-long position (38 contracts), unchanged WoW.
  • Implication:Extreme speculative bearishness poses a high short-squeeze risk, contrasting sharply with commercial optimism.

LITHIUM HYDROXIDE

  • Speculators:Dominantly bullish with a strong net-long position (3731 contracts), unchanged WoW. Positioning is strongly bullish (Z-score: 1.68).
  • Commercials:Hold a significant net-short position (-10011 contracts), slightly increasing bearish hedging WoW.
  • Implication:Persistent strong speculative bullish conviction, but extreme positioning warns of potential pullback.

COPPER- #1

  • Speculators:Strongly bullish with a large net-long position (42097 contracts), significantly increasing WoW. Positioning is strongly bullish (Z-score: 1.63).
  • Commercials:Hold a substantial net-short position (-55169 contracts), increasing bearish hedging WoW.
  • Implication:Aggressive speculative buying signals strong upward momentum, but elevated net-longs imply increased risk of profit-taking.
